intro: Ebermaiera minarum var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved ebermaiera, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its unique morphological features. The plant typically exhibits small, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a pale green hue. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
